metadata.name: Addnutriv 5 33 mcg ml Injection solution concentrate

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For use as a supplement to intravenous solutions given for total parenteral nutrition TPN

contraindications.disease: LD50 not available Copper toxicity can produce prostration behavior change diarrhea progressive marasmus hypotonia photophobia and peripheral edema Such symptoms have been reported with a serum copper level of 286 mcg dl Copper toxicity can also result in hemolysis and liver toxicity including hepatic necrosis which may be fatal D penicillamine has been reported effective as an antidote
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Copper is an essential nutrient which serves as a co factor for serum ceruloplasmin an oxidase necessary for proper formation of the iron carrier protein transferrin Copper also helps maintain normal rates of red and white blood cell formation Providing copper during Total Parenteral Nutrition helps prevent development of the following deficiency symptoms Leukopenia neutropenia anemia depressed ceruloplasmin levels impaired transferrin formation secondary iron deficiency and osteoporosis
